title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When a user enters an invalid date/time string in the 'default value' field of a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, such as '55/66/9999', the system does not reject the input and allows it to be stored.
EB: The BIRT report designer should validate the date value entered in the 'default value' field of a 'DateTime' type report parameter. If an invalid date/time string is entered, such as '55/66/9999', the system should reject the input and display an error message.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a 'DateTime' type report parameter.
4. In the 'default value' field of the report parameter, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
5. Save the report design.
6. Close and reopen the report design to verify if the invalid date string is rejected and an error message is displayed.
